p.s: In his last speech Obama talks about the lack of barriers that lead to great sucesssuccess in America.
Many people think, that this is aan important aspect of the core American values and the American Dream.

On the one hand, I think that this statement isn't very true, because in reality there are many equalities between the people in America, what makes it hard for people with another racial background or a not wealthy family to achieve great success.
On the other hand Obama is talking about his grandparents and his mother about their background and about the things they already achieved.
This is a thing that stands for the sucesssuccess through the lack of barriers.
Additionally Obama talks about his own experiences and his job as a community organizer (l. 21f.).
If you see that in the context of his election, this shows that you can achieve great success.
All in all I think that this statement is a core value of the American Dream and a great way of convincing the people to vote for him.
Also I would say that his statement is not completely false, but in the future there will be problems that the Americans have to face.
